title: Create _pkgslides.yml
text: get started examples, let’s load pkgslides.

title: Create _pkgslides.yml
text: Let’s first check see palmerpenguins exports. see three exports. first, path_to_file function, penguins penguins_raw datasets. Let’s say want include everything exported palmerpenguins. function want description , returns, parameters takes. dataset want know format data sources came . ’ll leave theme -now. don’t actually need include lines TRUE default case, ’ll leave now sake clarity. One extra thing aware using create_yaml() need provide folder path _pkgslides.yml live . now, ’ll create current working directory, represented ".". Like , ’re going explicitly declare options, even want default case. can double check new yaml file. pull file yaml::read_yaml() convert list string yaml::.yaml(). Finally, print formatting cat(). may notice TRUE FALSE choices replaced withyes . turns , yaml files accept valid options. may also notice sections may order, retain tree structure. , generated _pkgslides.yml one made hand.
code: library(palmerpenguins) ls("package:palmerpenguins") #> [1] "path_to_file" "penguins"     "penguins_raw" format:   theme: default   functions:     description: TRUE     returns: TRUE     parameters: TRUE     examples: FALSE     code: FALSE   datasets:     format: TRUE     source: TRUE     references: FALSE functions: all datasets: all create_yaml(   path = ".",   format_theme = c("default"),   format_functions = list(     description = TRUE,     returns = TRUE,     parameters = TRUE,     examples = FALSE,     code = FALSE   ),   format_datasets = list(     format = TRUE,     source = TRUE,     references = TRUE   ),   choose_functions = list("all"),   choose_datasets = list("all") ) #> Config written to './_pkgslides.yml' #> ./_pkgslides.yml yaml::read_yaml("_pkgslides.yml") |>    yaml::as.yaml() |>    cat() #> format: #>   functions: #>     return: yes #>     description: yes #>     parameters: yes #>     examples: no #>     code: no #>   datasets: #>     format: yes #>     source: yes #>     references: yes #>   theme: default #> functions: #> - file: all #> datasets: all

title: Create _pkgslides.yml
text: example generates pkgslides presentation . don’t need source code, want rest function slides. also specify want automatically choose slides yaml.R include functions. auto option produces slides internal functions file exported function. Thus, used single file, produces result . specify want .get_title() .collate_title() functions build_title.R functions build_presentation.R. Like Example 1, ’re going generate _pkgslides.yml current working directory ".", since ’s default, won’t specify . , can check file see formatting slightly different options now present, yields data.
code: format:   functions:     code: false functions:   - file: yaml.R     slides: auto   - file: build_title.R # will only include functions in slides     slides:       - .get_title       - .collate_title   - file: build_presentation.R # will include all functions create_yaml(   format_functions = list(     code = FALSE   ),   format_datasets = list(     format = TRUE,     source = TRUE,     references = TRUE   ),   choose_functions = list(     "yaml.R" = "auto",     "build_title.R" = c(".get_title", ".collate_title"),     "build_presentation.R"   ) ) #> Config written to './_pkgslides.yml' #> ./_pkgslides.yml yaml::read_yaml("_pkgslides.yml") |>    yaml::as.yaml() |>    cat() #> format: #>   functions: #>     description: yes #>     return: yes #>     parameters: yes #>     examples: yes #>     code: no #>   datasets: #>     format: yes #>     source: yes #>     references: yes #>   theme: default #> functions: #> - file: yaml.R #>   slides: auto #> - file: build_title.R #>   slides: #>   - .get_title #>   - .collate_title #> - file: build_presentation.R #>   slides: all #> datasets: all

title: Create _pkgslides.yml
text: line listed curly braces {true, false} mean one one options chosen. sake example, generic names used source files, function names, dataset names.
code: format:   theme: default   functions:     parameters: {true, false}     examples: {true, false} # target package must be installed to evaluate     code: {true, false}     # tests: {true, false} currently unsupported   datasets:     format: {true, false}     source: {true, false}     references: {true, false}     # view: {true, false} currently unsupported  functions:   - file: source1.R # will only include functions in slides     slides:       - function1       - function2   - file: source2.R # will include all functions   - file: source3.R     slides: auto  datasets:   - dataset1   - dataset2  ---  # Other options  format:   # lack of `functions:` # Excluding the `functions:` section is the same as setting all slides to 'true'.  #   This will show all slides for which content exists.  format:   theme: {default, ...} # see https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs/themes.html#using-themes # this is passed directly to the quarto document  functions: {auto, exported, all, none} # 'auto' uses exported functions and internal functions in the same file as an  #   exported function # 'exported' uses only exported functions # 'all' The default behavior, but should be there if the yml file exists  datasets: {all, none} # 'all' The default behavior, but should be there if the yml file exists # 'none' No datasets will be included

what: Automatically Generate Presentations for Source Code
title: Automatically Generate Presentations for Source Code
text: goal pkgslides make easier learn R packages converting existing documentation easily digested slideshow.

title: Automatically Generate Presentations for Source Code
text: can install development version pkgslides GitHub :

title: Automatically Generate Presentations for Source Code
text: basic example build render Quarto RevealJS presentation pkgslides:
code: pkgslides::build_presentation() #> Config written to './_pkgslides.yml' #> ℹ Loading pkgslides #> /Users/guslipkin/Documents/GitHub/pkgslides/pkgslides.qmd #> [31m #>  #> processing file: pkgslides.qmd #> [39m  |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |.......................                                               |  33% #>   ordinary text without R code #>  #>   |                                                                              |...............................................                       |  67% #> label: unnamed-chunk-1 (with options)  #> List of 1 #>  $ echo: logi FALSE #>  #>   |                                                                              |......................................................................| 100% #>   ordinary text without R code #>  #>  #> [31moutput file: pkgslides.knit.md #>  #> [39m[1mpandoc [22m #>   to: revealjs #>   output-file: pkgslides.html #>   standalone: true #>   self-contained: true #>   wrap: none #>   default-image-extension: png #>   html-math-method: #>     method: mathjax #>     url: >- #>       https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.0/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS_HTML-full #>   slide-level: 2 #>    #> [1mmetadata[22m #>   link-citations: true #>   width: 1050 #>   height: 700 #>   margin: 0.1 #>   center: false #>   navigationMode: default #>   controlsLayout: edges #>   controlsTutorial: false #>   hash: true #>   history: true #>   hashOneBasedIndex: false #>   fragmentInURL: false #>   transition: none #>   backgroundTransition: none #>   pdfSeparateFragments: false #>   lang: en #>   auto-stretch: true #>   title: pkgslides #>   subtitle: 0.1.0 #>   theme: default #>   scrollable: true #>    #> Output created: pkgslides.html

title: Create a Revealjs Presentation with Quarto — build_presentation
code: build_presentation(package = NULL, file = NULL, yaml = create_yaml())

title: Create a Revealjs Presentation with Quarto — build_presentation
text: package file path root directory R package source folder. file file name .qmd file. can path long ends `file_name.qmd` yaml `_pkgslides.yml` file function call `create_yaml()`

title: Create a Revealjs Presentation with Quarto — build_presentation
text: function creates renders .qmd presentation   return R object.

title: Create `_pkgslides.yml` — create_yaml
code: create_yaml(   path = ".",   format_theme = c(),   format_functions = list(),   format_datasets = list(),   choose_functions = list(),   choose_datasets = c() )

title: Create `_pkgslides.yml` — create_yaml
text: path file path want yaml file written. end slash kind. format_theme length-one character vector theme details format_functions named list format function options format_datasets named list format dataset options choose_functions list file function names choose_datasets vector dataset names

what: Collates a Slide with a Header and Content — .collate_slide
title: Collates a Slide with a Header and Content — .collate_slide
Collates a Slide with a Header and Content — .collate_slide
code: .collate_slide(   header,   content,   string = "{{content}",   fit = TRUE,   code = FALSE )

title: Collates a Slide with a Header and Content — .collate_slide
text: header length-one character vector. usually start `\n\n##` content length-one character vector function_details slide string length-one character vector formatted used `glue::glue(string, .open = "{{")` object replaced `content`. done avoid needing reach outside function environment access `content`. fit logical `r-fit-text` applied content supplied
